text: This game simply hit all the right notes and is still to me the true successor to the classic Final Fantasy we used to get with the Sakaguchi-Uematsu duo. And when you add the fact that a big part of the team behind this game previously worked on the Shadow Hearts franchise, you get a winning formula.
author: SupraDarky

text: This game was great, but I prefer The Last Story overall.
author: Gaming will NEVER be good again

text: True and agree with everything, this game is amazing
author: Matt Ferko

text: thank you ! still one of my favourite game ever
author: Louis Claudel

text: porghàçurthgàiurthà_çuh WAIT WHAT ????????? The team on lost odyssey worked on shadow hearts ???? DUDE !!!! those are like... 2 of my favourite RPGS !!!! what the fuck. ANd I didn't know. Fuck that crazy. You blew my mind there. It all makes so much sense now.... wow. Guess i know why you attack with a "ring" in lost odyssey now. Man, this is crazy, thank you !
author: Louis Claudel

text: @Louis Claudel Yeah, i didn't know that either! It really does start to make alot more sense now that I think about it

text: ah the shadow hearts connection explains all the NPC names lmao

text: @Imgur Heap such as ? do you have examples

text: @Louis Claudel how they're named, "profession/status" -> "first name"

author: Joey Ford

text: @Imgur Heap oooh shit you're right :o I remember those details. Awesome.
author: Louis Claudel

text: One of the surprise few game soundtracks Uematsu lent his talents for after the FF series.  And it sure shows.  I can recommend both the music and gameplay over the other Xbox game which comes to mind:  Blue Dragon.
author: Stewie G

text:
Such an underrated masterpiece.
Too bad it released on the 360 so it never got the succes it deserved.
author: Recht_voor_zijn_raap

text: I literally just finally finished this game early this morning! Great game, only took me 12 years and 3 attempts lol.

text: Wow, I started playing this when it launched, and I've had two attempts, but haven't beaten it yet. Maybe the third will do it like with you xD

text: I love this game so much i remember playing this game as a kid ovo

text: perfection

text:

Too bad it was not optimized and ran like crap.

text: This may be Uematsu's last great soundtrack.

text: I think the OG FF14 was great. Shame that Uematsu were not involved in ARR.
author: budakbaong siah

text: This game is awesome
author: Matt Ferko

text: A few of the dream stories were better than the main story. Great JRPG, but it was on the 360 so no chance for a sequel.
author: Solunous

text: This game was ok. The art style never quite hit my liking and the story was generic. The world wasn't fleshed out enough, same for the characters... especially the mortals. But I do remember Jensen's antics fondly. He was my favorite. The music is great though obviously.
author: A. K.-O.

text: Story was generic? How many games have a main cast of immortal characters? This is a bad take honestly.
author: orugnet

text: @orugnet that didn't make the story of the bad guy plotting to rule the world any less generic. In fact, it took anything that could have been special about the situation out of it - he's done it before, here we go again. Sigh. Yawn.
author: A. K.-O.

text:
I played the game last week and I totallly agree with you. The immortals concept is interesting, the dreams are very good stories, but the main plot is a total shame regarding all that. 
At the end of CD1 I was sure there would be time ellipse in the main story, permitting us to see the kids grow, maybe even die. 
But nope the game is all about kicking the ass of a big villain which is pretty disappointing regarding what could have been done
author: Baptiste Deneufbourg

text: The dreams where you read short stories were better stories than a majority of games.
author: Green

text: And better than this game's main story itself.
author: SupraDarky

text: I legitimately teared up during the one where he kept going back to tell stories to the sick girl in bed. Sticks with me even still.
author: Sam Smith

text: @Sam Smith Since it is basically the first story one unlocks, you know you are in for a treat every time you unlock them.
author: The Rated Oni Channel

text: What were those dream segments called again? A Thousand Years of Memories? I don't have this game nor a Xbox 360 anymore, but I've been meaning to find those stories again for the longest time now.
author: allthatishere

text: @allthatishere A Thousand Years of Dreams, and I believe all of them are on YouTube. Well worth a read.
author: SupraDarky

text: @SupraDarky Thank you, I really appreciate it!
author: allthatishere
